alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Lewis; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lewis, northwestern Upshur and south central Harrison Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1213 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong, heavy thunderstorm over Stonewall Jackson, or over Weston, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Buckhannon, Weston, Stonewall Jackson, Jackson Mill, Lost Creek, Jane Lew, Camden, Lorentz, Hodgesville and Horner. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 90 and 114. Route 33 between mile markers 1 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this and other storms in the area, and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause elevated levels on small creeks and streams, and ponding of water on highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other poor drainage areas and low lying spots.
